title: I have a website!
text: Hi! I‚Äôm starting a website so I have a bit more control over what I post and can put tutorials up in a way that works for me. Be patient while I get things started.

title: ManyBodies
text:
Note



See the collection of ties from this project on FetLife.


I‚Äôm starting a new project to tie (approximately) the same corset on as many different bodies as possible.
I currently have a bunch of people in Scotland and NL interested, so I‚Äôm not looking for new models just yet, but wanted to have a writing that explains what I‚Äôm thinking about the project.
It will be something like this one (with black wraps and busk and red boning), but customised for each individual‚Äôs body and preferences.













Figure¬†1: 



The photographs will also be customised for each model. Although I‚Äôd love to make something with the pose consistency of the grid project, I also know that not everyone is comfortable with nudity or every part of their body, so models can choose any cropping, like even just a close-up of one friction over clothing.
I‚Äôd like to collaborate with each model to write their own caption for their main photo, on the broad theme of bodies and ropes.
The intent would be to post each main photo as its own post on FetLife, and to make a compilation photo like the one above. I don‚Äôt think this project would lead to anything bigger (like a book or prints or a gallery exhibit) unless I sort out my photography setup sooner than I expect. But I‚Äôll have a written contract with each model so we‚Äôre clear on how we both can use the resulting photos and how we can handle it if the model needs to withdraw permission for further use of their images.

title: Rosette Wrap Video Tutorial
text: If mobility allows, it‚Äôs good to practice this one on your leg, so I did the video from that point of view.

title: Rosette Friction Tutorial
text: Rosette frictions are just an extended munter hitch. Follow the over-under pattern around until the rosette is the size you want. This is a great way to use up rope ends.

title: 2024 Pervert‚Äôs Choice Award
text:
It‚Äôs a highly unofficial award, with the most chaotic nomination and voting procedure, but still such a lovely way to spread positivity.



A (SFW-ish) picture from each month of 2024

title: Heart Friction Tutorial
text:
I worked this one out from a photo by @sweetangelvixen on Fetlife. I tried tying it the opposite direction to this first, which is possible, but not very easy. Top-to-bottom is definitely easier.
If mobility allows, it‚Äôs good to practice this one on your leg, so I did the video from that point of view.

title: Cored Square Knot Tie
text:
A 16x timelapse of a self-tie. The base took 11 minutes and three 8-meter red jute ropes, and the boning took 19 minutes and two 8-meter yellow linen ropes.

And the first few minutes at normal speed.

title: About
text: I attended my first shibari workshop in October 2023 and quickly became hooked on rope. I‚Äôm known for colourful self-tied corsets and intricate improvised designs.

title: Alternating CSK
text: Alternating cored square knots, starting with the base, then some boning patterns, then I took the core out and decided that looked pretty cool, ending with the rope kisses from this tie.

title: Mardi Gras Curve
text: My Mardi Gras tie, starting with the base and ending with the kisses. The colours each have a specific meaning: Purple represents justice, royalty, and creativity; Green represents faith, new beginnings, and abundance; and Gold represents power, the power of god, and the Easter octave.

title: FAQ
text:
When did you start?
I started tying in October 2023, after going to Ropes in Space (a local peer-learning ropes group). Before that, I‚Äôd been a rope bottom a few times with a play partner, so knew I really liked being tied, but wasn‚Äôt sure I‚Äôd be any good at tying. I really liked it and decided to try to learn more. I started improvising ties and posting them to FetLife in January 2024.


What resources do you use to learn?
I tend to prefer photos to videos, so I like The Duchy‚Äôs tutorials, and also enjoyed the book Essence of Shibari, but I‚Äôve recently started watching Shibari Study‚Äôs videos and love them. I like to use tutorials to learn the basics of a new kind of tie, then tie it several times from memory, and then start to get creative with it.
I‚Äôm still learning a lot, so I‚Äôm not an appropriate source of ropes education, especially about things like safety and suspension. I‚Äôd recommend taking in-person classes from experienced mentors if you want to get started on anything more than decorative ties.


What kind of ropes do you use?
As of August 2024, I have new rainbow ropes from Casual Rope that are 8m/6mm linen. I really like them. They‚Äôve written a useful explainer about linen ropes.

Most of my older ties are with 6mm jute, each 8 meters long. I got them on Etsy from someone I subsequently found out is problematic, so I‚Äôm hoping to learn to treat and dye my own ropes now.


Are these really self-ties?
If it‚Äôs tagged self-tie, I tied myself :) For those expressing disbelief, I‚Äôm pretty flexible, have good spatial awareness to do knots behind my back, and also use some tricks to start frictions at a more accessible place and move them to the back.


How long does it take?
The more intricate corset ties usually take about an hour or two the first time if I‚Äôm improvising (and have to untie a bit when I change my mind about something), and 30-45 minutes if I‚Äôm tying them once I know what I‚Äôm doing.
I have an 11-minute video of tying a corset base at my typical speed.


Can I copy your ties?
Of course! I love if you @ me in the caption of anything you post that‚Äôs inspired by my ties (I won‚Äôt accept tags in photos unless I‚Äôm directly involved like the model or rigger, though).
I‚Äôm not sure what legal weight it holds, but I intend to share any of my own designs and images where I am the only rigger, model and photographer on a CC-BY-SA-NC license, which means you can use and remix them as long as you give me credit (BY), share resulting works under the same license (SA), and don‚Äôt use them for commercial purposes (NC).


Can you link to the tutorials for your ties?
Most of the ties I post are improvised, so sometimes I‚Äôm not even sure how I did them by the end. If I‚Äôm tying from someone else‚Äôs tutorial or inspired by a picture, I‚Äôll always link to it (let me know if I‚Äôm ever not giving appropriate credit).
Tutorials on this site


Do you teach workshops?
I don‚Äôt have any immediate plans to do online workshops, but I‚Äôd be up for teaching in-person workshops on self-tying corsets. DM me to enquire.

I‚Äôm teaching an intro to self-tied corsets at the Uncensored Market June 7th
If we get enough people signed up, I‚Äôll be teaching a weekend workshop with Captured Erotica hosted by TeVincula September 19-21, 2025 (details here).



Where did you get those cute panties?
The watermelon and sun/moon pants are from a UK Etsy seller called SproutOrganic.
The rainbow and purple/green swirl pants are from an Etsy seller who isn‚Äôt online anymore.





















Do you edit your photos?
Sometimes I‚Äôll edit out parts of the background in my messy room, and I‚Äôll often adjust the colour profile of an image to make the ropes stand out more. If I edit any more than that, I will disclose it in the caption. But I will never edit the shape of my body or the ropes themselves.


Will you tie me?
Probably not, as I‚Äôm too busy to tie regularly with existing partners. But I‚Äôm usually at Ropes in Space, so come by and say hi if you‚Äôre in Glasgow. It‚Äôs always nice to meet in a friendly public space to check the vibes first, anyways.

title: Blindfolded Tie
text: I originally tied this for the Shibari Study Kinktober challenge. Its a good exercise for figuring out how to use touch to assess a tie.

title: Grid Project
text:
I‚Äôve been working on a project for the past few weeks to create a sort of ‚Äúmood board‚Äù of different corsets to showcase the creative possibilities for a workshop on improvising corset designs.

High-res version (5452√ó7246, 7.6MB)
I tied 36 different corsets in every colour combination of my rainbow ropes: 6 different bases (red, orange, yellow, green, blue and purple) and 5 different boning patterns on each of them.

title: Corset Demo
text: I taught this corset at Ropes in Space in 2024. It takes two 8-meter (6mm) ropes for me.

title: Start to Art
text:
Warning



This workshop date has moved from March 28-30 to September 19-21



TeVincula is organising a 3-day luxury retreat in Scotland (September 19-21) and invited the incredibly talented photographer CapturedErotica and me to teach. We will give workshops on tying decorative designs and functional bondage, then capturing them through artistic photography. I‚Äôm so looking forward to seeing what we can create together.
Info and tickets

title: Panties in a Twist
text: This takes a single 8-meter (6mm) rope for me, but is a very customisable tie since you just use up the ends with the filigree pattern.

title: Self-Tie Corset Workshop at the Uncensored Market
text:
More info on the Fetlife event listing
Whether you‚Äôre a complete rope newbie or an experienced rigger looking to refine your skills, this workshop will take you through the process of creating a stunning, body-hugging Shibari corset ‚Äì perfect for play, performance, or simply for the joy of feeling hot as hell in rope.

What to Expect

üå∏ Step-by-step guidance on tying a Shibari corset on yourself
‚õìÔ∏è Techniques that emphasize body awareness, safety, and aesthetics
üî• A chance to explore self-bondage in a supportive and affirming environment
üé≠ Inspiration for integrating rope into your play, fashion, or performance art

Tickets will be available first at the Uncensored: Summer of Queer Love Launch Party on April 10th at The Corset Club. Tickets for the market and workshops will go on sale to the public the following day, but there are only 20 spots, so they may sell out quickly!
